ingredients: [{"ingredients":"500g raspberry"},{"ingredients":"500g caster sugar"},{"ingredients":"3 tbsp red wine vinegar"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Put the raspberries in a pan with the sugar and vinegar. Mash over a low heat for 10 mins until smooth and syrupy. Rub through a sieve into a clean pan."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Tip the seeds from the sieve into a bowl and stir in 300ml water, then sieve again to remove the last of the pulp from seeds. Pour the liquid into the pan with the sieved pulp, stir well and boil for 1 min. Pour into small sterilised bottles and seal. The cordial will keep unopened for a few months. Once opened, store in the fridge."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"5 peppermint tea bags"},{"ingredients":"140g blueberries"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp golden caster sugar"},{"ingredients":"large handful ice"},{"ingredients":"handful mint leaves"},{"ingredients":"a few lemon slices"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Boil the kettle and put the tea bags in a jug. Pour over 500ml boiling water and leave to steep for 5 mins. Meanwhile, put 100g blueberries in a jug, add the sugar and lightly crush with the end of a rolling pin or a potato masher. Remove the tea bags from the water, pour the tea over the blueberries and top up with another 300ml cold water. Add a large handful of ice to cool quickly, or chill until cold."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"When you’re ready to pack your picnic, pour the iced tea into bottles or flasks. Add a few sprigs of fresh mint, some lemon slices and the remaining blueberries. Seal and store in a cooler bag."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"200g granulated sugar"},{"ingredients":"5 ripe peaches , 4 stoned and chopped, 1 sliced to serve"},{"ingredients":"4 teabags"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Tip the sugar into a pan with 250ml water. Bring to the boil slowly, ensuring the sugar is fully dissolved. Add the chopped peaches and cook until very soft. Remove from the heat, mash the peaches with a fork, and leave to infuse for 1 hr."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Sieve the syrup through a fine sieve into a jug, mashing the fruit to release all the liquid. The syrup will keep in the fridge for one week."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Put the teabags in a large heatproof jug and pour over 2 litres boiling water. Leave to steep for 4 mins, then carefully remove the teabags. Leave to cool, then transfer to the fridge until chilled."},{"method":"STEP 4"},{"method":"Stir the peach syrup into the iced tea with some ice, or pour a little of the syrup into tall glasses and add the tea. Top up with more water, sparkling water or ice. Add peach slices to serve."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"100g cranberry"},{"ingredients":"100ml/3½fl oz cranberry juice"},{"ingredients":"500ml blood  orange juice (Sanguinello)"},{"ingredients":"juice of 1 lime"},{"ingredients":"thin wedges of lime"},{"ingredients":"thin wedges of orange"},{"ingredients":"mint  sprigs"},{"ingredients":"600ml Appletise, sparkling  apple juice  drink"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Put the cranberries into a medium size, rigid freezer container, cover with water (by about 2.5cm), freeze until solid."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Mix the cranberry juice in a large jug (about 1.5 litre) with the orange and lime juices."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"To serve, smash the sheet of frozen cranberries into shards and put in the bottom of eight highball glasses. Put a wedge of lime and orange and a mint sprig in each glass, then pour in the mixed fruit juices and top up with Appletise."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1l pear juice"},{"ingredients":"1 vanilla pod"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp golden caster sugar"},{"ingredients":"4 cardamom pods"},{"ingredients":"few slices root ginger"},{"ingredients":"25ml raw apple cider vinegar"},{"ingredients":"½ tsp rosewater"},{"ingredients":"250ml sparkling water"},{"ingredients":"ice"},{"ingredients":"rosemary sprigs"},{"ingredients":"thyme , leaves picked"},{"ingredients":"sliced red pear"},{"ingredients":"handful frozen redcurrants"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Pour the pear juice into a large pan. Add the vanilla pod, golden caster sugar, cardamom pods and root ginger, then bring to a simmer. Leave to cool completely, then strain into a punch bowl or jug."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Add the raw apple cider vinegar, rosewater and sparkling water. Garnish with rosemary sprigs, thyme, sliced red pear and a handful of frozen redcurrants. Add ice and serve."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"5 cardamom pods"},{"ingredients":"½ cucumber"},{"ingredients":"1 chamomile teabag"},{"ingredients":"½ bunch mint leaves , plus extra to garnish"},{"ingredients":"1 strip lemon zest"},{"ingredients":"5 cloves"},{"ingredients":"½ bunch rosemary"},{"ingredients":"tonic water , to top up"},{"ingredients":"ice"},{"ingredients":"few pomegranate seeds , to garnish (optional)"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Bruise the cardamom pods and slice the cucumber. Put them both in a large jug and add the chamomile teabag, mint leaves, lemon zest, cloves and rosemary. Top up with 500ml cold water. Leave to infuse in the fridge for 2-4 hrs. To serve, strain the infused water and pour 50ml of it into each glass. Top up with tonic water and lots of ice. Garnish each one with a few more mint leaves and pomegranate seeds, if you like."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"500ml pomegranate juice"},{"ingredients":"25g golden caster sugar"},{"ingredients":"handful of frozen blackberries"},{"ingredients":"250ml apple juice"},{"ingredients":"1 cinnamon stick"},{"ingredients":"1 star anise"},{"ingredients":"4 cloves"},{"ingredients":"3 black peppercorns"},{"ingredients":"1 orange, quartered"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Put the pomegranate juice, sugar, blackberries and apple juice in a saucepan. Add the cinnamon, star anise, cloves, peppercorns and orange. Heat gently until simmering. Taste for sweetness, then strain into heatproof glasses."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"300g golden caster sugar"},{"ingredients":"zest and juice 1 orange"},{"ingredients":"zest and juice 1 lemon"},{"ingredients":"450g rhubarb , chopped"},{"ingredients":"1 slice fresh root ginger , peeled"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Put the sugar in a large saucepan with 300ml water. Bring to a simmer then add the zest and juice of both the orange and the lemon along with the rhubarb and the ginger."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Cook the mixture over a medium heat until the rhubarb is falling apart."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Pour the mixture through a sieve lined with muslin into a clean heatproof jug then transfer to sterilised bottles. Keeps in the fridge for up to 1 month."},{"method":"STEP 4"},{"method":"Serve approx. 25ml of cordial per 100ml sparkling water, or to taste."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"½ fresh pineapple , cut into chunks"},{"ingredients":"2 mangoes , peeled and cut into chunks"},{"ingredients":"2 starfruit , sliced"},{"ingredients":"150ml guava juice (or other tropical fruit juice)"},{"ingredients":"50ml ginger beer"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Mix together all the fruit in a large bowl with the guava juice, then chill until ready to serve. At the last minute, pour over the ginger beer and serve with small cups or bowls on the side for spooning the drinks and fruit into."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"½  grapefruit (approx 125g)"},{"ingredients":"1 slice orange"},{"ingredients":"125g caster sugar"},{"ingredients":"3 cardamom pods , lightly crushed"},{"ingredients":"pinch coriander seeds"},{"ingredients":"few drops red food colouring"},{"ingredients":"ice"},{"ingredients":"25ml white grape juice"},{"ingredients":"1 slice orange (optional)"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Chop the grapefruit into small chunks and put them into a saucepan along with the orange slice, sugar, 125ml water, the cardamom pods and coriander seeds. Heat the mixture until simmering and cook for around 5 mins, crushing the fruit pieces with the back of a wooden spoon as it starts to soften to release the juices. Once the fruit has softened and the white pith has faded, take it off the heat and leave to cool. If you like you can add a splash of red food colouring to the syrup at this point."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Once the syrup mixture has cooled, strain it and discard the spices and fruit pieces. Fill a tumbler with ice and pour in 25ml of the syrup, the grape juice and 25ml cold water. Stir gently until the outside of the tumbler feels cold, then garnish with a slice of orange, if you like."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"handful of green grapes"},{"ingredients":"handful of blueberries"},{"ingredients":"4 tbsp grenadine"},{"ingredients":"300-400ml orange juice"},{"ingredients":"sparkling water , to top up"},{"ingredients":"4 bamboo skewers"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Thread the grapes and blueberries onto the skewers to make stirrers."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Pour the grenadine into four glasses. Gently tip the glasses and pour the orange juice down the inside of the glasses so it sits on top of the grenadine. Top up with sparking water, and add the stirrers to serve."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"250g caster or  granulated sugar"},{"ingredients":"3 large lemons , plus more to serve"},{"ingredients":"350g gooseberry , topped and tailed, then halved"},{"ingredients":"mint leaves from 3 sprigs, plus extra to serve"},{"ingredients":"ice and  sparkling water , to serve"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"In a large pan, gently melt the sugar in 250ml water. Meanwhile, using a vegetable peeler, pare away a few long strips of lemon zest. Squeeze the juice to give about 100ml."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Add the zest, juice, gooseberries and mint leaves to the pan, and bring to a simmer. Cook for 5-10 mins until the gooseberries are very soft, then mash with a potato masher and leave to cool. Strain through a sieve, pressing the flesh well to extract the juices, then chill thoroughly."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"To serve, dilute 4 tbsp of the lemonade base with 100ml sparkling water (or to taste), adding extra ice, lemon and mint."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"3 passion fruits , halved"},{"ingredients":"1 lemon , juiced"},{"ingredients":"1 egg white"},{"ingredients":"100ml alcohol-free spirit"},{"ingredients":"2 tsp sugar syrup"},{"ingredients":"handful of ice"},{"ingredients":"sparkling grape juice , to serve"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Scoop the flesh from four of the passion fruit halves into a cocktail shaker. Add the lemon juice, egg white, spirit and syrup and shake vigorously until frothy."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Add the ice, then shake again until the outside of the shaker feels cold. Double strain into martini glasses (see tip below)."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Top up the martinis with the grape juice and garnish with the remaining passion fruit halves."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"2 lemons , juice only"},{"ingredients":"2 limes , juice only"},{"ingredients":"1 lemon , thinly sliced"},{"ingredients":"1 lime , thinly sliced"},{"ingredients":"peach  nectar"},{"ingredients":"cloudy  lemonade"},{"ingredients":"a few sliced strawberry"},{"ingredients":"sparkling water"},{"ingredients":"mint sprigs"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Put the lemon juice and lime juice into a large jug. Add the sliced lemon and lime, and a handful of ice cubes. Add peach nectar to fill about one-third of the jug and top up to fill with lemonade."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Add the strawberries and top up with sparkling water and mint sprigs."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"50g fresh root ginger , roughly chopped"},{"ingredients":"300g caster sugar"},{"ingredients":"2 lemons , sliced, plus extra to serve"},{"ingredients":"sparkling water"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Place the ginger, sugar and lemon slices in a pan with 150-200ml water. Bring to the boil, then cook until the sugar dissolves. Take off the heat, leave to cool, then press through a sieve."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"To serve, pour into a pitcher and top up with sparkling water and extra lemon slices."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"3 unwaxed lemons, roughly chopped"},{"ingredients":"140g caster sugar"},{"ingredients":"1l cold water"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Tip the lemons, sugar and half the water into a food processor and blend until the lemon is finely chopped."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Pour the mixture into a sieve over a bowl, then press through as much juice as you can. Top up with the remaining water and serve with plain ice or frozen with slices of lemon and lime."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1 mango , peeled, stoned and chopped"},{"ingredients":"100g granulated sugar"},{"ingredients":"4 tsp green tea leaves"},{"ingredients":"small bunch  fresh mint"},{"ingredients":"1 lime , sliced"},{"ingredients":"ice"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Put half the mango in a saucepan with the sugar and 100ml water. Cook for 8-10 mins then strain through a sieve and leave the liquid to cool."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Meanwhile, pour 500ml boiling water into a large heatproof jug and add the green tea leaves. Leave to steep for 5 mins, then strain into a large glass jug and add 300ml cold water. Leave to cool completely then put into the fridge to chill."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Once cold, add the strained mango syrup to the chilled tea, along with the rest of the chopped mango, fresh mint and the lime slices. Fill up the jug with ice, stir gently and serve."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"100g ginger , scrubbed and roughly chopped"},{"ingredients":"1 lemon , chopped"},{"ingredients":"100g light muscovado sugar"},{"ingredients":"1-litre bottle chilled  lemonade or sparkling water, to serve"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Put the ginger and lemon in a bowl, pour over 300ml water and blitz with a hand blender until very smooth. Strain through a sieve into a bowl, then press the pulp to remove as much liquid as you can. Add the sugar to the bowl and blitz again."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Decant into a bottle. Chill until ready to use. Add the lemonade or sparkling water to dilute before serving."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"75ml elderflower cordial"},{"ingredients":"1l cloudy  apple juice"},{"ingredients":"small handful mint  leaves, roughly chopped"},{"ingredients":"bottle sparkling water"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"For a grown-up non-alcoholic drink, mix elderflower cordial with cloudy apple juice. Add a small handful mint leaves, stir well, then pour into a chilled flask."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"At the picnic, pour half glasses of the juice and top up with sparkling water."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1 ½ tsp ground cinnamon"},{"ingredients":"a good pinch ground cloves"},{"ingredients":"½ whole grated nutmeg"},{"ingredients":"2l apple juice"},{"ingredients":"2 tsp vanilla extract"},{"ingredients":"6 scoops vanilla ice cream"},{"ingredients":"dark rum (optional)"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Put the cinnamon, ground cloves, nutmeg, apple juice and vanilla extract in a large saucepan. Bring to a gentle simmer."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"When the apple juice has warmed through, add the vanilla ice cream and whisk vigorously with a balloon whisk until melted and combined with the hot apple juice – the ice cream should make a frothy top on the juice."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Pour a splash of dark rum into the bottom of the adults’ cups and top up with the hot punch. Garnish with Apple crisps."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"handful strawberries , hulled and halved"},{"ingredients":"1 kiwi fruit , peeled and chopped"},{"ingredients":"2 pineapple  rings, chopped"},{"ingredients":"sparkling  apple juice"},{"ingredients":"tropical fruit  juice"},{"ingredients":"soda  water"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Fill 8 glasses with a mixture made up of strawberries, kiwi fruit and pineapple rings. Fill the glasses with equal amounts of chilled sparkling apple juice, chilled tropical fruit juice and chilled soda water. Serve immediately."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"50ml cold lapsang souchong tea"},{"ingredients":"50ml lemon juice"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp marmalade"},{"ingredients":"½ – 1 tsp honey"},{"ingredients":"ice"},{"ingredients":"slice dried orange (optional)"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Put a coupe glass in the fridge to chill. Put the cold tea, lemon juice and marmalade in a cocktail shaker and stir to break down the marmalade so it starts to dissolve. Stir in the honey then add the ice."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Shake well, until the outside of the shaker feels cold, then double strain into the chilled glass. Serve as it is or garnish with a slice of dried orange, if you like."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"3 tbsp pomegranate seeds"},{"ingredients":"big bunch mint"},{"ingredients":"2 limes , quartered, plus slices to garnish"},{"ingredients":"1l pomegranate juice"},{"ingredients":"500ml lemonade"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"A day ahead, divide the pomegranate seeds between the holes in an ice cube tray, top up with water and freeze."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Reserve half the mint for serving, and tear the rest into a large jug with the lime quarters. Using a rolling pin, bash the mint and lime to release the flavours. Add the pomegranate juice and lemonade. Put ice cubes in each glass, then strain over the pomegranate mix through a small sieve. Garnish with lime slices and more mint."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"200g ginger , thickly sliced"},{"ingredients":"2 large lemons , peeled and juiced"},{"ingredients":"75g golden caster sugar"},{"ingredients":"100g light brown muscovado sugar"},{"ingredients":"ice"},{"ingredients":"1 litre soda or sparkling water"},{"ingredients":"mint sprigs, to serve"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Put the ginger in a saucepan set over a low heat with the lemon peel, sugars and 500ml water and stir until the sugars have dissolved. Increase the heat to medium, then simmer for 15-20 mins, or until reduced and syrupy. Remove from the heat and leave to cool completely."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Strain the syrup into a jug through a sieve lined with muslin. At this stage, you can transfer the syrup to a small sterilised bottle or jar and keep in the fridge for up to two weeks."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Pour the ginger syrup into a large serving jug. Tip in the lemon juice, fill with ice and top up with the soda water. Serve garnished with a few mint sprigs."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"300g raspberries"},{"ingredients":"50g raw honey (see tip)"},{"ingredients":"75ml raw apple cider vinegar (see tip)"},{"ingredients":"½ small pack mint , leaves only"},{"ingredients":"750ml bottle sparkling water"},{"ingredients":"ice"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Put half the raspberries in a large bowl and lightly crush some of them with a muddler or a potato masher. Pour over the honey, stir well, cover and leave in the fridge overnight."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"The following day, stir in the vinegar, then tip the mixture into a sieve over a large jug and press through using the back of a spoon."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Add the remaining raspberries, the mint leaves, sparkling water and ice. Stir gently to combine, then serve."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1cm thick slice of  cucumber"},{"ingredients":"1 sprig  mint"},{"ingredients":"few frozen red berries"},{"ingredients":"120ml clear, sparkling lemonade"},{"ingredients":"ice"},{"ingredients":"more frozen berries , chopped fruits, cucumber slice, mint, citrus – all optional"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Chop the cucumber and mint sprig into small pieces. Bring 200ml water to the boil in a small pan and then add the mint and cucumber. Turn off the heat and leave for 2 mins. Add a small handful of frozen berries, let them defrost for a minute, then crush them lightly with the back of a spoon. Strain the mixture. This will keep in the fridge for up to 24 hours and will be enough to make four drinks."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Pour 40ml of your strained mixture into a tall glass. Add a handful of ice and top up with 120ml lemonade. Garnish with whatever chopped fruit you like or some more frozen berries and mint leaves if you have them. Stir gently to combine."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1l pomegranate juice"},{"ingredients":"1 sprig rosemary"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp sumac"},{"ingredients":"1 cinnamon stick"},{"ingredients":"½ tsp coriander seeds"},{"ingredients":"½  orange , sliced"},{"ingredients":"¼ tsp orange blossom water"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Pour the pomegranate juice into a large saucepan. Add the rosemary, sumac, cinnamon stick, coriander seeds, and orange. Bring to a simmer then pour through a sieve into a jug. Stir in the orange blossom water and pour into heatproof glasses or cups."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1 tsp clear honey"},{"ingredients":"edible gold glitter"},{"ingredients":"small bunch coriander leaves"},{"ingredients":"juice 1 lime"},{"ingredients":"750ml pineapple juice"},{"ingredients":"a handful of ice"},{"ingredients":"400ml tonic water"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Dip a pastry brush in the honey and paint a line down one side of 4 tumblers. Sprinkle some edible gold glitter over the honey, dust off any excess, then put the glasses in the fridge."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Chop the coriander leaves and place in a cocktail shaker with the lime juice, 100ml pineapple juice and a handful of ice. Shake together until the outside of the shaker feels cold. Strain into the glasses, add extra ice cubes and divide 650ml pineapple juice and the tonic water between the glasses."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"300g caster sugar"},{"ingredients":"1½  lemons , sliced"},{"ingredients":"1 orange , sliced"},{"ingredients":"3 x 170g/6oz punnets raspberries"},{"ingredients":"ice and fresh mint , to serve (optional)"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Place all the ingredients in a large saucepan and pour over 350ml cold water. Bring to the boil, stirring often, then leave to cool. Pour through a sieve, pressing down with a spoon to extract all the juices. The syrup can now be stored in the fridge for up to 1 week. To serve, pour a little into a glass and top up with sparkling or still water, ice and mint."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1 tbsp sugar"},{"ingredients":"small bunch mint"},{"ingredients":"3 limes, juiced"},{"ingredients":"soda water"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Muddle the sugar with leaves from the mint using a pestle and mortar (or use a small bowl and the end of a rolling pin)."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Put a handful of crushed ice into 2 tall glasses. Divide the lime juice between the glasses with the mint mix. Add a straw and top up with soda water."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"8 lemons , plus extra slices to serve"},{"ingredients":"200g caster sugar , plus extra to taste"},{"ingredients":"140g raspberry , plus extra to serve"},{"ingredients":"ice , to serve"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Pare the zest from the lemons with a peeler, removing as little white pith as possible – cut away any pith you can from the strips. Juice the lemons and mix the juice, zest, sugar and raspberries with 1.2 litres of boiling water. Let cool, then sieve, pressing through juice with the back of a spoon. Add sugar to taste and chill in jugs. To serve, add a few lemon slices, raspberries and lots of ice."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"150ml pineapple juice"},{"ingredients":"50ml coconut milk"},{"ingredients":"25ml lime juice"},{"ingredients":"ice"},{"ingredients":"cherry , to garnish"},{"ingredients":"100g dark brown muscovado sugar"},{"ingredients":"1 pineapple , a few strips of skin, plus leaves to garnish"},{"ingredients":"5 black peppercorns"},{"ingredients":"5 cloves"},{"ingredients":"1 cinnamon stick"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"To make a mock rum syrup, put the dark brown muscovado sugar and 200ml water in a saucepan, stir well and heat gently until the sugar has dissolved. Add a few strips of skin from the pineapple, add the black peppercorns, cloves and a cinnamon stick, then bring to the boil. Turn off the heat and leave to infuse until cold. Strain into a jug and set aside in the fridge until needed. Will keep for up to three days."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Pour the pineapple juice into a tall glass, and add the coconut milk and lime juice. Stir gently. Fill up the glass with a handful ice then slowly add 25ml of the syrup so it sinks to the bottom. Garnish with pineapple leaves and a tinned cherry."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1l apple juice"},{"ingredients":"strips of  orange peel"},{"ingredients":"1 cinnamon stick , plus extra to garnish, if you like"},{"ingredients":"3 cloves"},{"ingredients":"sugar or honey, to taste"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Simmer the apple juice with the strips of orange peel, cinnamon stick and cloves for about 5-10 mins until all the flavours have infused. Sweeten to taste."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Serve each drink with a little orange peel and a piece of cinnamon stick, if you like."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"500ml smooth orange juice"},{"ingredients":"500ml smooth cranberry juice"},{"ingredients":"400ml sparkling elderflower drink"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Mix together orange juice and cranberry juice in a large jug. Slowly pour in the sparkling elderflower drink, as it will fizz up. Mix together and serve in tall glasses with ice."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"2 lemons , cut into quarters, pips removed"},{"ingredients":"150g punnet blackberries"},{"ingredients":"few mint sprigs, leaves picked"},{"ingredients":"50g icing sugar"},{"ingredients":"fizzy water or prosecco , to serve"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Put the lemons, blackberries, mint leaves, sugar and 200ml water into a food processor. Blitz until everything is finely chopped and juicy. Strain through a fine sieve, bottle and chill until ready to drink. Will keep for up to a week. Top up with an equal measure of chilled fizzy water or Prosecco to serve."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1 large or 2 small watermelons"},{"ingredients":"250ml lemon juice (from a bottle or squeeze your own)"},{"ingredients":"100g golden caster sugar"},{"ingredients":"1l bottle soda water"},{"ingredients":"1 lime , cut into slices"},{"ingredients":"small handful mint"},{"ingredients":"crushed ice"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Cut the top off the watermelon and hollow it out using a large spoon, fishing out any pips along the way. Mash the flesh through a sieve into a bowl. Put the flesh in a blender (or use a tall jug and hand blender) with the lemon juice and sugar, whizz to a purée, then stir in the soda."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Heap some ice into the hollowed-out watermelon and fill it with the lemonade mixture. Serve the rest in a jug with the lime slices and mint. Have a bowl of extra crushed ice on the side so people can help themselves."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1 tsp assam tea leaves (50ml tea)"},{"ingredients":"few drops of  vanilla extract"},{"ingredients":"25ml lemon juice"},{"ingredients":"3 tsp maple syrup"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp egg white"},{"ingredients":"ice"},{"ingredients":"10ml pomegranate juice"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Pour 150ml boiling water over the tea leaves, stir, then strain straight away. You want a strong, but not stewed tea. Mix in the vanilla extract and leave to cool."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Pour the lemon juice, maple syrup and 50ml of the tea into a cocktail shaker. Stir the egg white with a fork to loosen it, then add 1 tbsp to the shaker. Shake well until the mixture is frothy. Add a good handful of ice and shake again."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Double strain into a glass filled with ice. Top up the pomegranate juice with water to make 20ml, then slowly pour into the glass. Let it settle for a moment – the juice will float just underneath the egg white foam."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"300g golden caster sugar"},{"ingredients":"zest and juice 2 lemons"},{"ingredients":"450g blackcurrants"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Put the sugar in a large saucepan with 300ml water. Bring to a simmer then add the lemon zest and juice followed by the blackcurrants. Cook the mixture over a medium heat until the blackcurrants start to soften and burst."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Pour the mixture through a sieve lined with muslin into a clean, heatproof jug then transfer to sterilised bottles. Keeps in the fridge for up to 1 month."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Serve approx. 25ml of cordial per 100ml sparkling or still water, or dilute to taste."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"600g frozen raspberries"},{"ingredients":"juice 3 lemons"},{"ingredients":"225ml soda water"},{"ingredients":"9 ice cubes (roughly 170g)"},{"ingredients":"3 tbsp agave nectar"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Put all the ingredients in a blender or food processor and blitz until you get a smooth slush. Divide between six jars or cups to serve."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"2 tsp apple cider vinegar"},{"ingredients":"sparkling water , to top up"},{"ingredients":"1 sliced pear"},{"ingredients":"4 dried apricots"},{"ingredients":"75g golden caster sugar"},{"ingredients":"25g honey"},{"ingredients":"1 sprig  rosemary , plus extra to garnish (optional)"},{"ingredients":"1 strip lemon zest"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"To make the base syrup, put the sliced pear, dried apricots, golden caster sugar, honey, sprig of rosemary and a strip of lemon zest in a saucepan with 100ml water. Heat for 10 mins or until the sugar has dissolved and the pear is very soft, then leave to cool completely."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Strain the syrup into a jug, add the apple cider vinegar and chill in the fridge for at least 30 mins. Pour about 25ml of the syrup into a champagne flute and top with cold sparkling water. Garnish with a rosemary sprig, if you like."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"500g/1lb 2oz honeydew, Galia or cantaloupe  melon chunks (or a mixture), plus some melon balls to serve (optional)"},{"ingredients":"zest and juice 2  limes"},{"ingredients":"100ml/ 3 ½fl oz cloudy  apple juice"},{"ingredients":"200-250ml/7-9fl oz chilled white wine"},{"ingredients":"chilled  lemonade , crushed ice and a few bamboo skewers (optional), to serve"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Put the melon chunks in a blender or food processor with the lime juice and apple juice. Whizz to the smoothest you can get, then stir in the lime zest. Cover and chill until ready to serve."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"To serve, pour the melon mixture into a big jug with the wine, then add an equal part of lemonade and give it a good stir. Thread a few melon balls onto skewers, if you like, add one to each glass with some crushed ice, and top up with the melon spritzer."}]
